com.microsoft.azure.samples.authentication

Class ServicePrincipalExample

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.samples.authentication.ServicePrincipalExample

  • public class ServicePrincipalExample
extends Object
    Service Principal Example

    This example will show you how to make a request to Azure Resource Manager (ARM) using a ADAL4J and Azure Active Directory. You will need the following:

    1. Your Azure Active Directory Tenant ID
    2. Your Azure Active Directory Subscription ID
    3. Your Azure Active Directory Application Client ID
    4. Your Azure Active Directory Application Client Secret

    After gathering or creating each of those items, you should be able to add them to the source code below to execute your first authenticated request using a Service Principal with RBAC in Azure. Each of the items below are

    See Also:
    Creating a Service Principal

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        Request a listing of all resource groups within a subscription using a service principal for authentication.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments supplied at the command line (they are not used)

      • createResourceManagementClient

        protected static ResourceManagementClient createResourceManagementClient()
                                                                  throws Exception
        Use the ResourceManagementService factory helper method to create a client based on the management config.
        Returns:
        ResourceManagementClient a client to be used to make authenticated requests to the ARM REST API
        Throws:
        Exception - all of the exceptions

      • createConfiguration

        public static Configuration createConfiguration()
                                         throws Exception
        Create configuration builds the management configuration needed for creating the ResourceManagementService. The config contains the baseURI which is the base of the ARM REST service, the subscription id as the context for the ResourceManagementService and the AAD token required for the HTTP Authorization header.
        Returns:
        Configuration the generated configuration
        Throws:
        Exception - all of the exceptions!!
